span.title: Base StructureDefinition for dateTime Type: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

span.title: Base StructureDefinition for dateTime Type: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

a.title: Legend for this format

short.value: BeClinicalObservation Model

definition.value: Clinical Observation logical model

short.value: Unique identifier for the observation

definition.value: Unique identifier for the observation

short.value: Date when the observation was recorded

definition.value: Date when the observation was recorded

short.value: Date or period of the observation

definition.value: Date or period of the observation

short.value: Person, organisation or device that recorded the observation

definition.value: Person, organisation or device that recorded the observation

short.value: The professional that performed the observation

definition.value: The professional that performed the observation

short.value: The patient that this observation is about

definition.value: The patient that this observation is about

short.value: The request that this observation is fulfilling

definition.value: The request that this observation is fulfilling

short.value: Part of referenced procedure

definition.value: Part of referenced procedure

short.value: The specimen that was used when this observation was made

definition.value: The specimen that was used when this observation was made

short.value: The device used to generate the observation data

definition.value: The device used to generate the observation data

short.value: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made

definition.value: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made

short.value: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation 'name'

definition.value: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation 'name'

short.value: The value of the observation - typically a code, an amount or a date

definition.value: The value of the observation - typically a code, an amount or a date

short.value: Other observations that are part of this observation

definition.value: Other observations that are part of this observation

short.value: The status of the result value.

definition.value: The status of the result value.

short.value: A categorical assessment of an observation value

definition.value: A categorical assessment of an observation value

short.value: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range

definition.value: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

requirements.value: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

isModifierReason.value: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
